business.headline: Explained: Why Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders fell over 8.5% todayMazagon Dock Shipbuilders: Shares of the company were trading 8.52% lower at Rs 4,268.85 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) at 12:39 pm.

Paytm share price plunges 7% despite Q2 profit growth. Here's whyPaytm share price today: The digital payment firm's share price plunged sharply despite the company posting a net profit in the second quarter of the ongoing financial year.

Paytm showcases strong growth in revenue, delivers profit of Rs 930 crore in Q2Paytm Q2 results: The quarter also witnessed a steady rise in revenue and contribution profit, reflecting the success of Paytm's strategy of scaling payments and expanding its financial services offerings.

Hyundai Motor makes weak D-Street debut. Hold for long-term gains or sell now?Hyundai Motor India stock market listing: A long-term ride to profits or time for investors to hit the brakes after its lacklustre debut?
Sensex, Nifty open marginally higher led by gains in bank and IT stocks The S&P BSE Sensex gained 153.24 points to 81,304.51, while the NIfty50 added 36.80 points to 24,817.90

Hyundai Motor India, India's biggest IPO, disappoints on stock market debut Hyundai share market listing: The IPO, which closed with an overall subscription of 2.37 times, saw tepid interest from retail investors, who subscribed to just 50% of their allotted shares.

Hyundai IPO set for muted stock market debut on BSE, NSEHyundai India Share Price Listing: The IPO, which opened on October 15, faced a slow start, particularly from retail investors, who subscribed to just 50% of their allotted shares.

Bitcoin prices surge past $69,000: What's driving the rally? Bitcoin touched $69,408.1 (roughly Rs 58,35,227) on international exchanges on Monday, marking a recovery after the cryptocurrency was in a price slump for the last three months.
Bajaj Housing Finance Q2 results: Net profit jumps 21% YoY to Rs 546 croreThe revenue from operations also saw a significant rise, with the company reporting Rs 2,410 crore for Q2FY25.

Health Insurer Niva Bupa gets Sebi nod for Rs 3,000 crore IPO. Details hereThe IPO, which the company filed for back in June, will consist of a mix of Rs 800 crore in fresh shares and an offer for sale (OFS) that includes Rs 320 crore from Bupa Singapore Holdings and Rs 1,880 crore from Fettle Tone LLP.
Sensex, Nifty fall as IT and metal stocks drag markets lowerThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 73.48 points to close at 81,151.27, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 72.95 points to end at 24,781.10.

Hyundai IPO GMP improves slightly ahead of market listing. What to expect?Hyundai stock market listing: The initial public offering, which opened on October 15, has seen a rollercoaster ride in terms of investor interest and grey market performance.

Manappuram Finance shares drop 5% today, 24% in 8 days: What's behind fall?The shares of Manappuram Finance hit a low of Rs 145.50, marking a decline of nearly 24% over the past eight trading sessions.

No GST on life and health insurance? Here's how it will impact youThis change, if implemented, could bring relief to policyholders and support the insurance sector by lowering the costs of these essential services.

Tata Consumer Products shares plunge over 7% today. Here's whyTata Consumer Products share price: At 1:27 pm, the stock was trading at Rs 1015.85 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), down by 7.2%, as investors reacted to its muted performance.

RBL Bank shares crash 15% after Q2 results: What analysts are sayingRBL Bank share price: The private lender's shares plunged in intraday trading following the release of its Q2 FY25 earnings over the weekend.

Hyundai Motor India share price expectation: Check latest gmp before D-Street debut Hyundai Motor India IPO: The public issue opened on October 15, was initially met with hesitation from investors, but by the close on Thursday, October 17, 2024, it had been subscribed more than twice.
Explained: Why Kotak Mahindra Bank shares plunged 7% after Q2 resultsAt 1:02 pm, Kotak Mahindra Bank shares were down 5.18% to Rs 1,773 on the Bombay Stock Exchange.

Axis Bank shares dip slightly today after strong Q2 gains. Good time to buy? Despite a strong Q2, analysts are divided on Axis Bank's future prospects. Many brokerages have adjusted their target prices, reflecting a cautious outlook on the bank's near-term growth trajectory.

Waaree Energies IPO opens for bidding: Should you subscribe? Check latest GMPThe Waaree Energies IPO consists of a fresh issue of 2.4 crore shares, amounting to Rs 3,600 crore, along with an offer for sale of 0.48 crore shares, totalling Rs 721.44 crore.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: I'm Kalaignar's grandson, won't apologise: Udhayanadhi Stalin on Sanatana rowUdhayanidhi Stalin refused to apologise for 'Sanatana Dharma' remarks, stating that the comments targeted its alleged repressive practices towards women.

PM Modi arrives in Russia for Brics Summit, will meet Vladimir Putin today  Live UpdatesBesides Russia's Vladimir Putin, the Prime Minister is likely to meet Chinese President Xi Jinping, as well as hold bilateral talks with leaders from the other Brics member nations.

Cricket, hockey and wrestling among sports dropped from Commonwealth Games 2026Commonwealth Games 2026: Cricket, hockey, wrestling and shooting were among the sports that were dropped from the Glasgow edition. Only 10 sports have been retained in a trimmed version due to budget constraints.

10 IndiGo flights receive fresh threats, over 100 hoax calls in a weekIndiGo Airlines has reported a series of fresh threats affecting 10 of its flights, mainly on international routes, this morning. The incidents, involving multiple hoax calls, have pushed the total number of such threats received by the airline this week to over 100.
Israel claims it found $500 million in gold, cash in Hassan Nasrallah's bunkerThe IDF said that it was monitoring the bunker but had no plans to strike it as it was constructed under a hospital.

Bahraich violence: Supreme Court halts bulldozer action on accused for a dayThe Uttar Pradesh government has issued demolition notices to three people involved in communal violence in Bahraich over music being played during a religious procession.

Hyundai Motor India, India's biggest IPO, disappoints on stock market debut Hyundai share market listing: The IPO, which closed with an overall subscription of 2.37 times, saw tepid interest from retail investors, who subscribed to just 50% of their allotted shares.

CRPF schools, including 2 in Delhi, get bomb threats via e-mail: SourcesTuesday's development came just two days after a powerful blast ripped through a wall of a CRPF school in Delhi's Rohini area, as well as several Indian airlines getting more than 100 bomb threats in the past one week.

Why do planes dump fuel during emergency landings, and where does it go?While fuel dumping may seem counterintuitive, especially given current fuel prices, it remains a crucial safety measure in aviation.

9 seriously injured in blast at ordnance factory in JabalpurJabalpur Ordnance Factory Blast: According to information received by India Today, an aerial bomb exploded in the F6 section of the factory's building.

Indira Gandhi's 'artificial unity' barb returns to bite Congress 40 years onReflecting what Indira Gandhi said criticising the 'artificial unity' among opposition parties in 1984, the Congress is grappling with alliance challenges with INDIA bloc parties in Maharashtra and Jharkhand. The Congress is struggling to maintain cohesion within the bloc amid tensions over seat-sharing.

Brics Summit shows 'failure of Western efforts to isolate' Putin: ReportRussian officials already see the Brics Summit as a massive success. Vladimir Putin's foreign policy aide Yuri Ushakov said 36 countries confirmed participation, and more than 20 will send heads of state.

Viral: Bengaluru auto driver's 'genius' idea to teach Kannada during rideA Bengaluru auto driver, Ajmal Sultan, has gone viral for teaching basic Kannada through a poster inside his vehicle. Passengers can learn common phrases, like greetings and payment questions, while they ride.

Why Ajit Pawar's NCP is BJP-Sena Mahayuti's weakest linkAs the Mahayuti of the BJP, Shiv Sena and the NCP combine their forces for the Maharashtra election, the Ajit Pawar-led party is being seen as its weakest link. From Pawar's graft-tainted image to the NCP's failure of getting votes transferred, several factors make it the faltering wheel of a three-wheeled autorickshaw.

Why the TMC is so serious about Bijoya Sammelani events this yearFacing protests over the R.G. Kar rape and murder, Bengal's ruling party is using the traditional get-togethers as a platform of outreach for damage control ahead of bypolls for six seats

Can India trust China amid talks over disengagement along LAC? What experts sayExperts suggest that while this is a significant step in diffusing tensions between the two countries, India should be cautious about China's motives.
Delhi man finds 'centipede' in meal at VIP Railway lounge, recounts horrorA Delhi man shared a photograph of a live centipede that he found in his meal at IRCTC's VIP Executive Lounge.

Row over IAS officer's remark on temple loudspeakers, Hindu outfit protestsThe Madhya Pradesh IAS officer made the remark amid a debate on social media following the death of a 13-year-old boy while he was dancing to DJ music last week.

Jagmeet Singh pushes for India-Canada committee amid diplomatic row, turned downJagmeet Singh claimed that Canada's democracy was under threat and blamed the Conservative Party for blocking the move to create an India-Canada committee.

Woman who survived October 7 Hamas attack dies by suicide on 22nd birthdayShirel Golan survived the October 7, 2023 Hamas attack at the Supernova music festival in Israel. She was found dead at her home on her 22nd birthday.

Liam Payne had 'pink cocaine' in his system at time of death: Toxicology reportPost-mortem results indicated that Liam Payne was alone at the time of the fall and "was going through an episode of substance abuse", according to prosecutors.

Cyclone Dana to hit Odisha, Bengal in 48 hours, schools shut, evacuations onCyclone Dana will likely cause extremely heavy rainfall in Odisha and West Bengal on October 24 and 25, and heavy rainfall in both states till Friday, the weather body said.

Delhi air quality remains 'very poor', anti-pollution restrictions imposedDelhi's air quality is expected to deteriorate further, with the AQI likely to exceed 400 and fall into the 'severe' category on Tuesday and Wednesday, due to stubble burning in neighbouring states and unfavourable wind conditions.

Hamas to be led by Doha-based committee, no chief to succeed Sinwar: ReportIn 2017, Yahya Sinwar was named the Hamas chief in Gaza. He became the overall leader of the Palestinian militant group after Ismail Haniyeh, head of Hamas's Doha-based political wing, was assassinated in July this year.

Actor Ajith Kumar on his racing comeback: It's the only time I feel wholeActor Ajith Kumar is all set to make his racing comeback after 15 years. He is now a team owner and one of the drivers who'd be participating in 24h Dubai 2025 and European 24H Series Championship.

Salim Merchant urges ban on resale ticket sites as concert demand soars in IndiaSinger Salim Merchant calls for a ban on resale ticket sites in India to combat scalping amid rising concert demand. He urges fans to avoid third-party purchases to keep tickets affordable.

BB 18 Day 14: Avinash Mishra and Karan Veer's fight escalates after personal commentsTension escalated between Avinash Mishra and Karan Veer Mehra as the actors exchanged personal remarks. During the latest episode, Avinash also made derogatory comments about Karan Veer.

Aamir Khan in talks to star in Kishore Kumar's biopic: ReportBollywood star Aamir Khan is reportedly in talks to star in legendary singer Kishore Kumar's biopic. The film will be helmed by director Anurag Basu.

sports.headline: Watch: Virat Kohli arrives in Pune ahead of 2nd India vs New Zealand TestIndia's star batter Virat Kohli has reached Pune to join the squad for the second Test against New Zealand. Despite a strong performance in the second innings in Bengaluru, India will be looking to him for inspiration to level the series.

Cricket, hockey and wrestling among sports dropped from Commonwealth Games 2026Commonwealth Games 2026: Cricket, hockey, wrestling and shooting were among the sports that were dropped from the Glasgow edition. Only 10 sports have been retained in a trimmed version due to budget constraints.

Prithvi Shaw reacts after getting dropped from Ranji Trophy squadMumbai batter Prithvi Shaw has been dropped from the Mumbai team from Round 3 of the Ranji Trophy. Shaw has reportedly been dropped due to disciplinary issues.

Polly Inglis earns maiden call-up as New Zealand women name squad for India ODIsPolly Inglis has been named in the New Zealand Women's squad for their India tour, marking her debut in a 15-member squad. The series serves as vital preparation for the upcoming ODI World Cup.

MI, KKR amongst five IPL franchises bidding for teams in The Hundred: ReportSeveral IPL franchises, including Mumbai Indians and Kolkata Knight Riders, have shown interest in acquiring teams in The Hundred, a tournament run by the ECB. The bidding process aims to finalise investors by 2025, with a potential hybrid ownership model being considered.

Smith out for 0, Marnus bowls medium pace as AUS prep for India TestsSenior Australia batter continued to have poor fortunes in Sheffield Shield in the build-up to the Border-Gavaskar Trophy. Batting against Victoria Smith scored 3 and 0 in two innings. On the other hand, Marnus Labuschagne was spotted bowling medium-pace.

Clement Lenglet joins Atletico Madrid injury list ahead of Lille tieAtletico Madrid faces a major setback as Clément Lenglet joins the injury list ahead of their Champions League match against Lille. With key players already out, Simeone's squad faces a tough challenge.

Michael Clarke backs Bancroft to open for Australia in Test series vs IndiaFormer Australian captain Michael Clarke backs Cameron Bancroft's return to the Test team, advocating for his selection as an opener against India. Clarke highlights Bancroft's consistent domestic performance as a key factor.

Sanju Samson reveals what Rohit Sharma told him after final snubStar Indian wicketkeeper Sanju Samson has revealed what captain Rohit Sharma told him after he was dropped from the playing XI in the last T20 World Cup final.

Watch: After Ramandeep, Ayush Badoni pulls off stunner in Emerging Asia CupIndia A's Ayush Badoni picked up a sensational catch in the Emerging Asia Cup on Monday, October 21. Badoni, standing at long off, put in a full stretch dive to dismiss UAE's Jawadullah off Ramandeep Singh's bowling.

Virgil van Dijk to extend contract at Liverpool: Discussions are ongoingLiverpool captain Virgil van Dijk has said formal discussions over a contract extension have begun at the Premier League club. The defender's current contract is set to expire this season.

Mentality not enough to beat Real Madrid: Borussia Dortmund coach SahinBorussia Dortmund's head coach Nuri Sahin warns his team about the challenges of facing Real Madrid in the Champions League. Emphasizing a complete performance, Sahin reflects on his personal connection to the Bernabéu.

Jay Shah's entry to alter ICC rules? Board recommends changesThe International Cricket Council has recommended changes in the chief's tenure. The move comes right before Jay Shah is set to take over the cricket body.

New Zealand star Kane Williamson to miss second Test against IndiaIndia vs New Zealand, Pune Test: New Zealand have revealed key batter Kane Williamson will miss the second Test against India due to injury.

Used to travel in trains by the toilets: Sakshi Malik on career strugglesIn an interview with India Today, firmer India wrestler Sakshi Malik discussed her early struggles as a wrestler, including travelling by train next to toilets. She also shared insights from her autobiography Witness and her experience in the wrestlers' protest.

KL Rahul shouldn't be benched after just one Test match: Venkatapathy RajuFormer India cricketer Venkatapathy Raju has come out in support of struggling batter KL Rahul and backed him to get selected in the second Test against New Zealand in Pune.

Sarfaraz Khan welcomes baby boy a day after Bengaluru Test heroicsSarfaraz Khan announced the birth of his baby boy just a day after his impressive 150-run performance in India's Bengaluru Test against New Zealand. He shared the first picture of his newborn on Instagram, alongside his father Naushad Khan.
IND vs NZ: Team India gets rousing reception in Pune ahead of 2nd TestIndian Cricket Team arrived in Pune amid loud cheers ahead of the second Test against New Zealand set to begin from October 24.

He shared the first picture of his newborn on Instagram, alongside his father Naushad Khan.
IND vs NZ: Team India gets rousing reception in Pune ahead of 2nd TestIndian Cricket Team arrived in Pune amid loud cheers ahead of the second Test against New Zealand set to begin from October 24.

Nadal not worried about Djokovic's grand slam tally amidst retirementAs Rafael Nadal approaches his retirement, the Spanish tennis legend expressed peace with ending his career with 22 Grand Slam titles, content despite Novak Djokovic surpassing him with 24 major championships.

Ruturaj Gaikwad to lead India A on Australia tour, Ishan Kishan named wicketkeeperThe Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) named a 15-member India A squad for the Australia tour on Monday, October 21 announcing Ruturaj Gaikwad as captain.

WI vs ENG: Salt and Pepper to open for England? Selection news thrills fansEngland are likely to open with a new batting pair of Philip Salt and Michael Pepper in the ODI series on the tour to West Indies.

Abhishek Sharma shines in India A's thumping win over UAEIndia A secured a convincing victory over UAE, led by Abhishek Sharma's all-round brilliance, jumping to the top of Group B in the Emerging Asia Cup with two wins from two matches.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
